senses.sense_definition: A non-standard, often dialectal or informal pronunciation or spelling of <w>yes</w>.

examples.text: <w>Yus</w>, I reckon that is exactly what happened.
Are you going to the market? <w>Yus</w>, I am leaving now.

senses.sense_definition: Either of two letters, little yus (Ѧ) or big yus (Ѫ), used in the early Cyrillic alphabet to represent nasal vowel sounds.

examples.text: The scholar identified a big <w>yus</w> in the Old Church Slavonic manuscript.
Most modern Slavic languages have lost the sounds originally represented by the <w>yus</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The plural form of the noun <w>yu</w> (referring to the Cyrillic letter Ю).

examples.text: The student practiced writing his <w>yus</w> until the curves were perfect.
There are three <w>yus</w> in this short paragraph.
